content.p: The Library provides a variety of assistive software and hardware to assist our disabled students and those with dyslexia and/or a long-term medical condition. A dedicated PC with these software programs installed is located on level C, in Room GC19. We also provide help and advice on how to use this services and work closely with IT Services if any specific adjustments are required. Please note that use of some of these services will require a referral from the Disability and Learning (Academic) Support Services. Please see our contact page for telephone and email contact points.
